title: United Kingdom Mining Production
description: Mining production in the United Kingdom decreased 4.70 percent in September of 2022 over the same month in the previous year. Mining Production in the United Kingdom averaged 1.96 percent from 1969 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 853.90 percent in February of 1973 and a record low of -90.50 percent in February of 1972. Mining production measures the output of businesses operating in the mining sector and it accounts for 12 percent of total industrial production, including extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas (9.6 percent), other mining and quarrying plus mining support (2.3 percent) and mining of coal and lignite (0.1 percent). This page provides the latest reported value for - United Kingdom Mining Production - plus previous releases, historical high and low, short-term forecast and long-term prediction, economic calendar, survey consensus and news.
author: Office for National Statistics
